#inner_join

##1. brief description
inner_join is a function used to combine two data frames or tibbles based on common values within their respective columns.

##2. what package contain it
inner_join is a function within the dplyr package. 

##3. when to use it
The inner_join function is most useful when trying to combine a set of data with its metadata. It can also be used to compare two separate data sets.
